Did you know? Alaska is the only state that is home to all three species of North American bears (black, grizzly, and polar), and gray wolves inhabit 85% of the land area.

Ok, but I lived in Canada and Bears there did kill people. A Grizzly Bear in Alaska killed a photographer and his girlfriend and I suppose a polar bear attack must be pretty horrible.

Grizzly bears in Alaska and Canada are moving further North due to warming temperatures and as a consequence are coming into contact/mating with Polar Bears, thus creating a hybrid bear more adapted for the change in climate. Evolution. https://twitter.com/danielleee_jm/status/973070031322890240 …

There once was a bear in Alaska, which died - shot - young. part Grizzly & part Polar Bear (both usually very long distances away from each other) It had fish & nuts/berries, & squirrel in its' tummy found in autopsy. That's not supposed to happen - but it did. seen on @ NatGeo

A8. Polar, Kodiak and grizzly bears are all on the checklist for guests of “Three Bears of Alaska.” Over 17 days, travelers take in bear viewing in Kaktovik, Kodiak and Denali National Park, Alaska. http://bit.ly/2DDdOt3 # TravelAlaskaChat # HiddenGemspic.twitter.com/BDWu6uJcbI

Certainly possible. But grizzly bears are generally considered to be more aggressive than polar bears. In Alaska, grizzlies will drive polar bears away from whale carcasses, for example. I do think it's rare for a death like this to occur though!
Yes, please destroy Alaska and demolish our dwindling polar bear and grizzly bear populations.

Tax bill included drilling approval for Alaska refugee that is home to grizzly bears, black bears, and denning sites for polar bears, and provides a wildlife corridor that stretches from the Canadian border across Alaska to the Chukchi Sea. https://buff.ly/2AHpaOw

True story. When I visited Alaska a park ranger gave me this advice for identifying the bears I might run into: If you climb a tree, and it climbs up too – it’s a Black Bear. if it shakes you out of the tree – it’s a Grizzly Bear. If there are no trees – it’s a Polar Bear. XD
by the way they use semi-auto to hunt/defend against all kinds of bears in Alaska & NW USA. Very few can one shot a polar/grizzly bear.
